comment_body: This PR don't Squash Merge, Because some commits need to be cherry-picked to wpa/hostap_2_9

it seems to me the debian packages is complicated, and most of the patches are not targeted for macsec use cases, i am wonder if it we can just build the binary and copy into macsec docker and use it without installing the deb packages, will that be easier?

> it seems to me the debian packages is complicated, and most of the patches are not targeted for macsec use cases, i am wonder if it we can just build the binary and copy into macsec docker and use it without installing the deb packages, will that be easier?

Could you give me a sub-module example in sonic-buildimage which is just building binary and coping them into docker? I saw most of them are building debian packages.
i assume you need to update the macsec linux driver to enable xpn support in the linux, but I cannot find it.
also the sonic wpa plugin should be updated as well?

This pull request was made to allow for the current developers of SONiC wpa plugin to adapt their implementation to support XPN.  There are no plans to update the current wpa Linux driver adaptation, since in SONiC, only SONiC wpa plugin will be used.  All other wpa drivers should be excluded in SONiC.

> This pull request was made to allow for the current developers of SONiC wpa plugin to adapt their implementation to support XPN. There are no plans to update the current wpa Linux driver adaptation, since in SONiC, only SONiC wpa plugin will be used. All other wpa drivers should be excluded in SONiC.

We are patching the sonic kernel to support xpn. We are still interested in adding xpn support in virtual switch. Do you know if we need to patch libnl to support xpn?

> We are patching the sonic kernel to support xpn. We are still interested in adding xpn support in virtual switch. Do you know if we need to patch libnl to support xpn?

In current upstreamed libnl3, there is no included support in the genl netlink handling for MACsec at all; only in the route netlink handling is there any included MACsec support, but this is insufficient to fully configure MACsec Linux driver... genl netlink handling is needed for this.  However, as mentioned in our MACsec HLD discussions, I have written all the genl netlink parsing/handling for MACsec and am planning on contributing this support to SONiC as needed.  This genl netlink handling supports the latest definition of Linux MACsec driver attributes (from Linux if_macsec.h), which includes needed XPN attributes.

wpa-supplicant probably needs enhancement for improved detection of driver capabilities.  For instance, current MACsec driver does not support XPN cipher suites, but there is no way to convey what cipher suites are supported by the driver to the PAE/KaY component via the current wpa-supplicant driver interface.

> I have written all the genl netlink parsing/handling for MACsec and am planning on contributing this support to SONiC as needed

which part of sonic module are you planning to contribute to? here, libnl, macsec virtual sai?
@qdbwlr, can you do a force push on your branch? we have enabled static check and would like to run against this pr.
